constructor

  • new Fault(points?: Vectord | Serie<IArray>): Fault

Accessors

bcType

  • get bcType(): string | BC
  • set bcType(bc: string | BC): void

  • Returns string | BC

  • Set the type of boundary conditions. Possible string values are tt, bb, tb or bt

    Parameters

    • bc: string | BC

    Returns void

bounds

  • get bounds(): BBox

  • Returns BBox

burgers

  • set burgers(burgers: Vectord | Serie<IArray>): void

  • Set the burger's vectors for all segments. Possible arguments are a [[Serie]] of size the number of segments times 2, an array of size the number of segments times 2, or an array of size 2:

    // We consider a fault made of 3 segments
    f.burgers = dataframe.series.U // one for each segement
    f.burgers = [0,1, 0,1, 0,1] // one for each segement
    f.burgers = [0,1] // set for all segments

    Parameters

    • burgers: Vectord | Serie<IArray>

    Returns void

dics

  • get dics(): Dic[]

  • Returns Dic[]

elements

  • get elements(): Segment[]

  • Returns Segment[]

tics

  • get tics(): Tic[]

  • Returns Tic[]

Methods

addDic

  • addDic(dic: Dic): void

  • Add a displacement inequality constraint

    Example

    const f = new Fault()
    ...
    f.addDic( new UserDic( u => {
         const slip = Math.sqrt(u[1]**2 + u[2]**2)
         if (slip > Math.abs(u[0])) return [u[0], 0, 0]
         else return u
    }))

    Parameters

    • dic: Dic

    Returns void

addElement

  • addElement(s: Segment): void

  • Parameters

    • s: Segment

    Returns void

addTic

  • addTic(tic: Tic): void

  • Add a traction inequality constraint.

    Example

    const f = new Fault()
    ...
    f.addTic( new UserTic( t => {
         if (t[0]<0) return [0, t[1], t[2]]
         else return t
    }))

    Parameters

    • tic: Tic

    Returns void

tooClose

  • tooClose(p: Point, delta?: number): boolean

  • Check if point p is too close to an element

    Parameters

    • p: Point
    • delta: number = 1

    Returns boolean
